articles.headline: Synching Just Became a Cinch
articles.snippet: Sharpcast introduced SugarSync, a new, automated Internet backup and synchronization service.
articles.abstract: Sharpcast introduced SugarSync, a new, automated Internet backup and synchronization service.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you’ve ever lost important computer files, then you already know about the five stages of grieving: Denial, Anger, Bargaining, Depression and Moving to the Amish Country.

articles.headline: Supplier Under Scrutiny on Arms for Afghans
articles.snippet: To arm Afghan forces to fight against Al Qaeda and the Taliban, the U.S. has relied on a fledgling company that has provided ammunition that is more than 40 years old.
articles.abstract: To arm Afghan forces to fight against Al Qaeda and the Taliban, the U.S. has relied on a fledgling company that has provided ammunition that is more than 40 years old.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by C. J. Chivers, Eric Schmitt and Nicholas Wood and written by Mr. Chivers.

articles.headline: Equity Loans as Next Round in Credit Crisis
articles.snippet: Lulled by good times, millions of Americans borrowed against the roofs over their heads. Now the bill is coming due.
articles.abstract: Lulled by good times, millions of Americans borrowed against the roofs over their heads. Now the bill is coming due.
articles.lead_paragraph: Little by little, millions of Americans surrendered equity in their homes in recent years. Lulled by good times, they borrowed  sometimes heavily  against the roofs over their heads.

articles.headline: Pressured, Motorola Splits in Two
articles.snippet: Under pressure from investor Carl C. Icahn, Motorola spun off its mobile phone unit, as it struggled to come up with new products to replace the highly successful Razr.
articles.abstract: Under pressure from investor Carl C. Icahn, Motorola spun off its mobile phone unit, as it struggled to come up with new products to replace the highly successful Razr.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a two-month strategic review of its businesses, Motorola said on Wednesday that it would split itself into two separate publicly traded companies, spinning off its unprofitable mobile phone unit to investors.

articles.headline: Finding Political News Online, the Young Pass It On
articles.snippet: Younger voters tend to be not just consumers of news but conduits as well, sending out links and videos to friends.
articles.abstract: Younger voters tend to be not just consumers of news but conduits as well, sending out links and videos to friends.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Barack Obama’s videotaped response to President Bush’s final State of the Union address  almost five minutes of Mr. Obama’s talking directly to the camera  elicited little attention from newspaper and television reporters in January.

articles.headline: Inquiry Assails Accounting Firm in Lender’s Fall
articles.snippet: An investigation into the failed subprime lender New Century Financial found that its accounting firm, KPMG, enabled “improper and imprudent practices.”
articles.abstract: An investigation into the failed subprime lender New Century Financial found that its accounting firm, KPMG, enabled “improper and imprudent practices.”
articles.lead_paragraph: A sweeping five-month investigation into the collapse of one of the nation’s largest subprime lenders points a finger at a possible new culprit in the mortgage mess: the accountants.

articles.headline: The Builder Who Pushes Tokyo Into the Clouds
articles.snippet: Minoru Mori, Japan’s most prolific developer, will finish one of the world’s tallest buildings in May, and plans to build or help build 10 more huge complexes in downtown Tokyo.
articles.abstract: Minoru Mori, Japan’s most prolific developer, will finish one of the world’s tallest buildings in May, and plans to build or help build 10 more huge complexes in downtown Tokyo.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO  Minoru Mori, Japan’s most prolific developer, will finish one of the world’s tallest buildings in May. Many of his colleagues might consider the 101-story Shanghai World Financial Center the crowning achievement of a long career. But Mr. Mori has lots of plans for a 73-year-old.

articles.headline: Senators Seek Details About Bear Stearns Deal
articles.snippet: Senators are demanding information about how the Federal Reserve arranged the $30 billion shotgun marriage of JPMorgan Chase and Bear Stearns.
articles.abstract: Senators are demanding information about how the Federal Reserve arranged the $30 billion shotgun marriage of JPMorgan Chase and Bear Stearns.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Senior senators signaled their unease on Wednesday with the Federal Reserve’s shotgun marriage of JPMorgan Chase and Bear Stearns, demanding detailed information by next week about how the $30 billion deal was reached.

articles.headline: Early Dazzle, Then Tough Path for a Governor
articles.snippet: Gov. Deval Patrick of Massachusetts, who easily won in 2006 calling for hope and change, has struggled in office.
articles.abstract: Gov. Deval Patrick of Massachusetts, who easily won in 2006 calling for hope and change, has struggled in office.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOSTON  Gov. Deval Patrick has lately addressed doting crowds around the country as a surrogate for Senator Barack Obama of Illinois, his friend and fellow gifted orator. Last month, Mr. Obama even acknowledged borrowing language from Mr. Patrick’s stump speeches, casting a flattering light on a novice politician barely known outside Massachusetts.

articles.headline: Alaska Suit Against Lilly Is Settled
articles.snippet: The prospect of a pending Supreme Court case that could sweep away many lawsuits against drug companies loomed over Alaska’s $15 million settlement with Eli Lilly.
articles.abstract: The prospect of a pending Supreme Court case that could sweep away many lawsuits against drug companies loomed over Alaska’s $15 million settlement with Eli Lilly.
articles.lead_paragraph: The prospect of a pending Supreme Court case that could sweep away many lawsuits against drug companies loomed over Alaska’s decision to settle the state’s suit against Eli Lilly over the schizophrenia drug Zyprexa, lawyers for Lilly and the state said Wednesday.
